class_flight_data module

Analyzes commercial airflight data from an online location

class class_flight_data.FlightDataAnalyzer(*, airlines: DataFrame | None = None, airplanes: DataFrame | None = None, airports: DataFrame | None = None, routes: DataFrame | None = None)

Bases: BaseModel

Initilizes a tool for analyzing commercial airflight data to support sustainability studies.

When the class is called, the flight data is automatically downloaded and stored into pandas dataframes (after removing superfluous columns).

airlines

Dataframe with airline information such as Name, IATA and ICAO codes, Country, Active status, etc.

Type:

pd.DataFrame

airplanes

Dataframe with Name and IATA and ICAO codes of airplanes.

Type:

pd.DataFrame

airports

Dataframe with airport information, such as Name, City, Country, IATA and ICAO codes, Latitude & Longitude, Timezone, etc.

Type:

pd.DataFrame

routes

Dataframe with route information, such as Airline, Source Airport, Destination Airport, number of Stops, etc.

Type:

pd.DataFrame

class Config

Bases: object

Configuration class to change the behavior of Pydantic’s BaseModel. Set arbitrary_types_allowed to True to allow pandas dataframes to be stored as attributes.

arbitrary_types_allowed = True
plot_airports_map(country)

Plots a map with the locations of airports in the specified country.

Parameters:

  • self (class) – The FlightDataAnalyzer class itself.

  • country (str) – The name of the country.

Return type:

Nothing. Plots map.

distance_analysis()

Plots the distribution of flight distances for all flights.

Parameters:

self (class) – The FlightDataAnalyzer class itself.

Return type:

Nothing. Plots histogram with distance distribution.

plot_flights_from_airport(airport, internal=False, cutoff_distance=1000, limit=200)

Plots a map with the flights departing from the specified airport. If internal is True, only flights with destination in the same country as the departure airport will be plotted. If too many flights are found, only the 200 largest routes will be plotted. The color of the lines will be red for short-haul flights (distance <= cutoff_distance) and orange for long-haul flights.

Parameters:

  • airport (str) – The name of the departure airport.

  • internal (bool, optional) – Whether to plot only internal flights or all flights. Default is False.

  • cutoff_distance (int, optional) – The maximum distance for a route to be considered short-haul. Default is 1000.

  • limit (int, optional) – The number of routes to plot. Default is 200.

Return type:

Nothing. Plots map.

plot_most_used_airplane_models(countries=None, n=10)

Plots the N most used airplane models by number of routes. If countries is None, it plots for all dataset. If countries is a string or list of strings, it plots just for that subset.

Parameters:

  • countries (str or list of str, optional) – The name of the country or list of countries. Default is None.

  • N (int, optional) – The number of airplane models to plot. Default is 5.

Return type:

Nothing. Plots map.

plot_flights_from_country(country, internal=False, cutoff_distance=1000, limit=200)

Plots a map with the flights departing from all airports in the specified country. If internal is True, only internal flights (within the same country) will be plotted. If too many flights are found, only the 200 largest routes will be plotted. The color of the lines will be red for short-haul flights (distance <= cutoff_distance) and orange for long-haul flights.

Parameters:

  • country (str) – The name of the departure country.

  • internal (bool, optional) – Whether to plot only internal flights or all flights. Default is False.

  • cutoff_distance (int, optional) – The maximum distance for a route to be considered short-haul. Default is 1000.

  • limit (int, optional) – The number of routes to plot. Default is 200.

Return type:

None

calculate_short_haul_routes(country, cutoff_distance=1000)

Calculates the short-haul routes for a given country. Short-haul routes are defined as routes with a distance less than or equal to cutoff_distance. The function returns a dataframe with the short-haul routes sorted by distance.

Parameters:

  • country (str) – The name of the country.

  • cutoff_distance (float, optional) – The maximum distance for a route to be considered short-haul. Default is 1000.

Returns:

Dataframe with the short-haul routes sorted by distance.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

aircrafts()

Prints only the aircraft names

Parameters:

self (class) –

aircraft_info(aircraft_name)

Prints the aircraft information for the given aircraft name If it does not exist, it throws and error and calculates the most similar aircraft name based on the input and suggests it to the user

Parameters:

  • self (class) –

  • aircraft_name (str) – The name of the aircraft

Returns the most similar aircraft name based on the input name

Parameters:

  • input_name (str) – The name of the aircraft

Returns:

The most similar aircraft name

Return type:

str

Returns the similarity between two strings based on the shared characters

Parameters:

  • input_name (str) – The name of the aircraft

  • target_name (str) – The other aircraft name

Returns:

The similarity between the two strings

Return type:

float

airport_info(airport_name)

Prints the airport information for the given airport name No error checking as not needed in task statement.

Parameters:

  • self (class) –

  • airport_name (str) – The name of the airport

model_computed_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, ComputedFieldInfo]] = {}

A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding ComputedFieldInfo objects.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'arbitrary_types_allowed': True}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {'airlines': FieldInfo(annotation=Union[DataFrame, NoneType], required=False), 'airplanes': FieldInfo(annotation=Union[DataFrame, NoneType], required=False), 'airports': FieldInfo(annotation=Union[DataFrame, NoneType], required=False), 'routes': FieldInfo(annotation=Union[DataFrame, NoneType], required=False)}

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo].

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.
